(44) 28thConclusions,Minute 2.)Russia.Sentences onBritish Sailors.1. The War Cabinet had a discussion on the Russo-Polishsituation in the light of the latest communication on this subjectfrom Premier Stalin.2. The War Cabinet also discussed the reply to be sent to theRussian request that the ships to be handed over to them should besailed to Russia by British crews. It was agreed that this requestcould not be acceded to.3. Reference was also made to the severe sentences that hadbeen passed by the Russian Courts on two British sailors arrestedafter a drunken brawl. The War Cabinet agreed that Sir A. ClarkKerr should be asked to press M. Molotov for an early reply to thepersonal representations made to him by the Secretary of State forForeign Affairs, in view of the possibility of ParliamentaryQuestions.A record of the discussion and conclusions reached on thesethree matters is contained in the Secretary's Standard File of WarCabinet Conclusions.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,27th March, 1944.
